pullRequest.body:
This will be useful to make order isomorphisms act on flags.

From LeanCamCombi


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [4eb54d5ff4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21024/commits/4eb54d5ff4a9b7d3e34a663f655d70001dfeec11)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Action.End` (new file)|217|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ applyMulAction`
`+ applyOpMulAction`
`+ apply_faithfulSMul`
`+ apply_op_faithfulSMul`
`+ op_smul_def`
`+ smul_def`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@Vierkantor, this one is a distant relative of #22141, which you just reviewed.
Please don't move files and add new stuff in the same PR. A PR should do one thing and it sounds like there's a discussion we could have about the moving.
I've moved the move to #22505

> All of these definitions would work for any type of isomorphism.

And indeed `applyMulAction` already exists for (almost) all other kinds of isomorphisms.
This looks okay to me but still I don't know the maths that may motivate this. So you get an approval but I don't feel confident enough to delegate the PR.

Hmm... I find it hard to understand the motivation here. All of these definitions would work for any type of isomorphism. Also, why did you rename the file to `Algebra/Order/Group` when it is not about `OrderedGroup`s? I'm probably not the right reviewer for this.
This looks okay to me but still I don't know the maths that may motivate this. So you get an approval but I don't feel confident enough to delegate the PR.

Let's have something to distinguish these docstrings. Maybe:
```suggestion
/-- The tautological action by applying an automorphism `r âr r` on `Î±`. -/
instance applyMulAction : MulAction (r âr r) Î± where
  smul := (â)
  one_smul _ := rfl
  mul_smul _ _ _ := rfl

/-- The tautological action by applying the inverse of an automorphism `r âr r` on `Î±`. -/
```
Do we have this for `Equiv`?
No we do not. Do you want me to add it?

I think you should either:
1. Add the `áµáµáµ` versions for all existing equivs in their own PR (harder review, must think about diamonds)
2. Rebase this PR and get it merged (easy review, extends an existing pattern)

or
1. Remove the  `áµáµáµ` version from this PR and get it merged. (easy review, extends an existing pattern)
2. Add the `áµáµáµ` version for all equivs in a subsequent PR. (harder review, must think about diamonds)
The changes to this file feel like a `chore:` PR in their own right.
Oh in fact it was a PR in its own right already: #22505

pullRequest.title: feat: tautological action of `RelIso` on the ground type
